snippet: In his latest act of protest, Pyotr Pavlensky set fire to the entrance of Russia’s Federal Security Service and was charged with vandalism.
abstract: Russian police arrest artist Pyotr Pavlensky after politically-motivated performance in which he set fire to entrance of Federal Security Service's Moscow headquarters; Pavlensky is part of  community of country's artists who are increasingly taking up burden of political opposition, as Putin regime consolidates its control over independent media and dissenting voices.
lead_paragraph: In his latest act of protest, Pyotr Pavlensky set fire to the entrance of Russia’s Federal Security Service and was charged with vandalism.

headline.main: Russian Artist Sets Security Service’s Door on Fire
headline.print_headline: With Russia’s Political Opposition Marginalized, a Protest Artist Takes Up the Cause
